Description:
Two Titles, And A Large Designer Home
Perfectly situated in a prestigious locale, this magnificent custom-built home (2009 HIA Awards finalist) is a modern masterpiece of space and style. The 4-bed, 4-living room floorplan will appeal to families, whilst the privilege of space and great shedding is ideal for a tradesman. Set on a fully landscaped double block, boasting bay views and close proximity to Drysdale village, this one is truly unique!
-2-storey floorplan zoned perfectly for entertaining and private family time
-Downstairs: office, cinema, lounge, alfresco, kitchen/living hub, laundry and powder room
-Upstairs: master suite, living zone, 3 further queen-sized BRs, bathroom and toilet
-Porcelain, Southern Box and quality carpet flooring throughout
-Tall ceilings, superb fixtures and custom window furnishings
-Ducted Inverter heating and cooling ensures total comfort
-Office ideally placed at the facade for a home run business
-Cinema with raised seating platform, projector and surround sound
-Private lounge with built-in bar and direct access to protected Alfresco entertaining
-Fabulously spacious kitchen/dining/living hub at the rear with cosy gas log fire
-Chefs kitchen with butler’s pantry and superior European appliances
-Smeg 900mm gas/electric cooker, Asko dishwasher, glass rangehood and splashback
-Indoor-outdoor atmosphere with access to the Alfresco deck and backyard
-Fully equipped laundry with laundry chute and storeroom
-The powder room is convenient to the living zones
-Understair storeroom
-The inviting upper storey boasts a muted and rejuvenating ambiance
-5-star master suite with bay-view balcony, His and Hers WIRs and luxurious ensuite
-Ensuite with bay-view spa bath, twin vanities, double shower and separate toilet
-Generous upper living zone with built-in storage
-2 minor BR’s with built-in desks and shelving
-Classy family bathroom with bath, shower, laundry chute and separate toilet
-Ducted vacuum downstairs
-Double remote garage with internal access
-The 2nd block is separately titled - an awesome investment for the future!
-2nd lock includes double gated kerb access and a lawn framed by landscaped gardens
-Huge shed/workshop (9x16m approx) plus a high-clearance carport sits at the rear
-The ultimate ‘mancave’ with wood-burning heater and plenty of space for tinkering
-14,500L rainwater tank with pump and automated sprinkler system
-Set within a short walk of all family amenities, shopping and a choice of schools
-In the heart of The Bellarine, well-known for wineries, beaches and organic produce
This urban lifestyle property is sure to impress! Arrange an inspection today!
Insights: 26-28 Sundial Drive, Clifton Springs VIC 3222 was last sold in 2020 and 49 other 4 bedroom house in Clifton Springs have recently been sold.

Description:
Imposing Modern Home on Large Block
This spacious as-new home is perfect for the large or blended family. The home has much to offer being centrally located close to the Clifton Springs Primary School, corner shops, boat ramp, tennis courts and playground.The layout of the home has multiple options which would suit any family.
Perfect for supervising a young family in the back yard, entertaining multiple age groups or escaping for plenty of fresh air and exercise close by.
Built for downstairs entertaining the smart open plan kitchen with Caesarstone benchtops and stainless steel appliances, dining and family rooms have direct access to outdoor entertaining areas. Located adjacent to these areas is a rumpus room or lounge. The spacious, main bedroom is located at the front of the home with classy, modern ensuite and walk in robe.
Upstairs the views from the second living area are expansive with plenty of light filtering in from the north facing windows. This area is open and bright with a further four, queen-sized bedrooms and family bathroom. The largest of these bedrooms has the potential for an ensuite to be incorporated if desired.
The yard area is spacious with rear access possible on both sides of the property. Ample space on the south side of the home would allow for substantial shedding for a boat or caravan. The double garage provides access to the interior of the home and rear yard. All in all this as new home has great potential for it's next vendor.
Insights: 4 other 5 bedroom house in Clifton Springs have recently been sold.

Description:
Family Living at its Best
If you are searching for a modern and large family home in a quiet court, then this could be the one. It is set on a generous and elevated 614m2 block with a north facing backyard and overlooks an expansive park/playground, ideal for children of all ages.
The list of features includes:
• 4 bedrooms plus built in study, main bedroom with ensuite and WIR
• 3 living areas, including theatre room, family room and formal lounge
• Lovely open kitchen with island bench and beautiful polished timber floors
• The covered alfresco area has double corner sliding doors to make a massive
indoor/outdoor living area perfect for summer BBQs or entertaining.
• 2 split systems, central gas heating, ducted vacuum and a 5KW solar system
• There is easily accessible and large under house storage
• Newly landscaped front yard and retaining walls
• The elevated outlook over the park across the road gives a feeling of space and
openness and also allows you to supervise the kids.
This intelligently designed and well-presented property represents a fantastic opportunity for a family to purchase a lovely modern place to call home in a nice, established and quiet area.
Phone now for more information and an inspection.
Insights: 23 Delungra Avenue, Clifton Springs VIC 3222 was last sold in 2017 and 49 other 4 bedroom house in Clifton Springs have recently been sold.

Description:
Large 4BR home between the bay and shops
Set in a quiet bayside pocket between the water and the Drysdale shopping precinct, this charming 4-bedroom family home has a lot to boast about. The solid brick veneer construction encases a light-filled split-level floor plan with 2 very spacious living zones and inviting bedrooms zoned for family bliss. The quiet location and leafy green surrounds add to the tranquil ambiance within.
The façade faces north so the entrance veranda soaks up the sun, making a lovely spot to chat and relax. Entry is into the open plan lounge dining space on the lower level, with dual aspect over the front yard. This area has dedicated spaces for formal dining and soft furnishings but functions well as one large entertaining area proportioned for family fun. The master bedroom sits adjacent, with walk-in robe and fresh en suite. A smaller bedroom with built-in robe sits close to the master and augurs well as a nursery, office or guest bedroom. Zoned away from the rest of the floorplan, these rooms boast a retreat-like feel, privatised for parents.
Step up to the huge open plan kitchen/dining/living area - the true hub of the home! This bright and airy zone offers desirable outdoor living on a connecting easterly deck, as well as ample space to spread out and enjoy indoors.
The kitchen features a suite of well-maintained F&P appliances including an electric wall oven and gas cooktop. Mums will love the Omega dishwasher and storage-laden cabinetry. The dining area is proportioned for grand scale dinners with the deck close by for BBQing.
Children can relax and play in the living space at the rear, easily supervised from the kitchen. A split system assists comfort. Ducted gas heating throughout.
The minor bedroom wing adds to the family-friendly feel of this home. Kids will enjoy their own privacy in the 2 queen bedrooms with built-in robes. The main bathroom, separate toilet and laundry are also in this wing.
The generous DLUG boasts internal access. A private lawn wraps the back of the home and connects with the deck. The spacious front yard adds to the street appeal.
This will be home for one lucky family, or an excellent addition to an investment portfolio. Currently leased until May 2017 for $390 per week.
- Quiet, light-filled family home between the bay and Drysdale shopping precinct
- Solid brick, 4BR design with a split level floor plan including 2 large living zones
- Master with en suite, 2nd BR (nursery or office) and lounge/dining on lower level
- Open plan family hub with dining deck and minor bedroom wing on upper level
- Kitchen with well-maintained F&P appliances and Omega dishwasher
- Generous DLUG with internal access, ducted heating and split system
Insights: 30 Carawatha Avenue, Clifton Springs VIC 3222 was last sold in 2017 and 49 other 4 bedroom house in Clifton Springs have recently been sold.

Description:
Precious space and a great family vibe
The large block and family-sized 5-bedroom home deliver the privilege of space at this timeless and comfortable home in Clifton Springs. Set within walking distance of local shops, school, park and sporting precinct, this property offers an easy and blissful family lifestyle.
The 2-storey design, with master suite and 2nd bedroom (nursery or study) above, offers great parental privacy. The large master bedroom features private balcony with bay views, split system and space for living furniture. The fully tiled en suite is luxurious with bath and shower.
Downstairs, the free flowing floor plan caters well for a family. Kitchen/dining features granite benchtops, electric oven and gas cooktop. The adjoining sun drenched patio and undercover alfresco area provide a huge footprint for entertaining. The cosy living zone offers surround sound and split system, and extends to a family room, proportioned for a billiard table. The zone-able office, or homework hub, completes the living zones below.
Further bedrooms, sit in a wing with the laundry and separate toilet. One bedroom features en suite access to the 2-way bathroom. Built-in robes and full height glazing add to the livability of these rooms. Ducted heating throughout.
The long driveway delivers endless bike and scooter fun and space for 'toys'. Detached DLUG (11x5m approx) with hidden utility space behind. A 5000L rainwater tank supports the large lawns and garden.
You'll find space and a great family vibe here in Mirrabooka!
Insights: 52 Mirrabooka Drive, Clifton Springs VIC 3222 was last sold in 2017 and 4 other 5 bedroom house in Clifton Springs have recently been sold.

You can enjoy the bay views even whilst washing the dishes. All bedrooms have built-in robes. Updated central bathroom and updated ensuite. Huge covered outdoor patio. Double garage plus workshop area and extra room for a boat. You will enjoy the serenity.

Description:
BRILLIANT FAMILY HOME
This approx. 980 square meter block of land in the sought after Clifton Springs market is perfect for the large family unit, with a naturally light filled front lounge, huge 2nd open plan living area with kitchen, dining and family room, 4 Bedrooms, study and alfresco entertaining. The large master bedroom with WIR and full ensuite, wood fire & ducted heating are added comforts expected in a home of this size; whilst shedding is well and truly covered with a single lock up garage and a further 6x9 meter shed perfect for the project car or completed pride of joy! This location allows for easy access to the Clifton Springs Golf Club, The Dell waterfront, schools and public transport whilst the huge yard, large home and off street parking makes for a Brilliant Family Home

Description:
RARE CORNER BLOCK HITS THE MARKET
Rarely now are we getting land that has potential for views of Corio Bay. As there are less and less blocks available. People are discovering that Clifton Springs is a good lifestyle choice and why not? It has all you need to enjoy work, rest and play. This 626m2 (approx) corner block has many options: build your dream home and enjoy the day/night views or develop two homes, live in one rent/sell the other. A very short walk to the water's edge to walk the dog and experience the change in the view daily. The Age newspaper a while ago wrote an article that said people choose to live within 20 minutes of all they need for daily life. This is true for Clifton Springs, good range of Primary and High Schools, shopping complexes, medical centre's, sporting clubs, cafes, restaurants, bike trails the list goes on.
Insights: 1 Cumbalum Court, Clifton Springs VIC 3222 was last sold in 2017.

Description:
Everything points to Sundial!
This magnificent home combines the highest level of comfort and style and is situated in a highly sought after location close to schools and amenities.
This is a perfect family home offering - 4 spacious brms complete with BIRs (master with generous WIR & ensuite), a delightful open plan family/meals/kitchen area great for relaxing or entertaining, theatre room and an additional living area to the front of the home.
The heart of the home has a great entertainers kitchen appointed with a 900mm s/s gas oven, dishwasher, WI pantry, large island bench with stone bench tops and large fridge space already plumbed for water.
With a stunning northerly orientation entertaining continues outside with a generous sized undercover alfresco area and secure low maintenance rear yard.
With ducted vacuum, WI Linen, gas ducted heating, split system, ceiling fans, surround sound to both the main living & theatre rooms, solar assist gas hot water and external blinds to the alfresco, this home is ready to move in and perfect for your family lifestyle.
Insights: 21 Sundial Drive, Clifton Springs VIC 3222 was last sold in 2017 and 49 other 4 bedroom house in Clifton Springs have recently been sold.

Designed with a bullnose veranda, red clinker-brick style construction, bay windows, ceiling roses and an exposed brick open fire place to recreate a period Victorian home. This solid 3 bedroom Clifton Springs home comprises 2 bathrooms, 2 genuine living areas, open plan timber kitchen & tiled meals, new and modern enclosed entertaining area with spa and ample off street parking, there is nothing that this home wants for other than a new owner. Positioned within walking distance to Clifton Springs Golf Course and waterfront walking tracks along The Dell, easy access into Drysdale Shopping and in a town with the best growth potential on the Bellarine Peninsula; this is your opportunity to buy into the in demand Clifton Springs property market for under 400K.

Address: 43 Bay Shore Avenue Clifton Springs VIC 3222
Description:
WHAT A BEAUTIFUL GARDEN
The drought has broken and this garden has benefitted from the rain. A cottage garden, relatively maintenance free. But thatâ??s not all, this home offers a feel of come in, sit and relax. The current owner has enjoyed this home but now itâ??s time for another chapter in her life. This home overlooks the Clifton Springs Golf Course. Enjoy the peace and serenity of overlooking the flowers so caringly planted for enjoyment. The floorplan of this home is functional and a good size. Whether you are looking to downsize or become a first home owner then this will tick boxes. Clifton Springs although established over forty years ago is still quite undiscovered suburb on the Bellarine Peninsula where people move in and never leave. All you require is at your fingertips whether that be schools, medical centres, bowling, fishing, netball, tennis etc. For recreation you can ride a bike or a horse along the Bellarine Rail Trail. You can enjoy food at many restaurants and cafes. The lifestyle you choose is available here.
